definition: to rein in/to compel/to force/to carve/to engrave/(literary) to command/to lead/bridle/(physics) abbr. for 勒克斯[le4 ke4 si1], lux
classifier for a ream of paper
to order/to command/an order/warrant/writ/to cause/to make sth happen/virtuous/honorific title/season/government position (old)

sentences.english: Another 690 were ordered to renovate their plants and improve product quality, it said.
sentences.chinese: 另外690家企业被勒令整治以提高产品质量。

sentences.english: Cameroon Ministry of Communications has also ordered three companies of informal long-distance passenger business for rectification.
sentences.chinese: 喀交通部还勒令三家非正规长途客运公司停业整顿。

sentences.english: The next day, the unit will be ordered to suspend business for reorganization.
sentences.chinese: 第二天，该单位将被勒令停业整顿业务。

sentences.english: Last week the ministry of public security ordered police to stop such practices.
sentences.chinese: 上个星期，公共安全部门勒令警方停止该行为。

sentences.english: Students with more than four unexcused absences shall be dropped from the class.
sentences.chinese: 未经允许缺席四次以上会被勒令退学。

sentences.english: But the royal government enforced a surrender strategy and order him withdraw.
sentences.chinese: 但朝廷执行投降政策，勒令其退兵。

sentences.english: He was once rusticated in Cambridge.
sentences.chinese: 他在剑桥大学上学时曾一度被勒令停学。

sentences.english: At the core of the solution are government-decreed industrial and traffic crackdowns.
sentences.chinese: 这种解决之道的核心在于政府勒令打压工业和交通。

sentences.english: A total of 8,600 were shut over the last month.
sentences.chinese: 有总共8600家网吧在上一个月里被勒令关闭。

sentences.english: Twenty students have been flunked out and had to leave the school.
sentences.chinese: 二十名学生考试不及格而被学校勒令退学。

sentences.english: Several major battery manufacturers with shares traded in China have issued notices saying production is suspended.
sentences.chinese: 行动中，几家上市的大电池厂都被勒令停产。

sentences.english: Penalties could include big fines or an order to demolish the plants.
sentences.chinese: 惩罚条款可能包括大额罚款或者勒令拆除工厂。

sentences.english: After the failure of the task, calendar handed guns were ordered to Wenxuan et al.
sentences.chinese: 任务失败后，历文轩等人被勒令上交枪支。

sentences.english: The court also ordered him to give back a 20,000-yuan "reward" to the provincial forestry department.
sentences.chinese: 法庭还勒令其向省林业部门交还2万元的“奖金”。

definition: to order/to enjoin/to charge/to instruct sb to finish sth
to set a time limit/time limit/deadline
to tidy up/to reorganize/to consolidate/to rectify

to forbid sb to go out/to confine to one location (e.g. student, soldier, prisoner, monk etc)/to ground (as disciplinary measure)/to gate/to curfew/restriction on movement/ban on visiting a place/out of bounds/off limits/caveat
to expel (a member of an organization)/to fire (an employee)
